name: moving people and objects as a business

children.name: to take sb or sth from one place to another
deliver
children.definition: to take letters, newspapers, goods etc to someone’s home or office: dẫn, vận chuyển
examples: ▪ Your computer will be delivered between 9.00 a.m. and 2.00 p.m.
▪ How soon can you deliver?
deliver something to somebody/something: dẫn/vận chuyển cái gì tới ai/cái gì
▪ If your order is ready, it will be delivered to you tomorrow
.▪ Unfortunately the package was delivered to the wrong address.
delivery[countable/uncountable noun]sự vận chuyển
when letters, newspapers, goods etc are taken to someone’s house or office:
▪ We offer free home delivery for every purchase over $150.
▪ a newspaper delivery boy

children.name: transport
children.definition: to move large quantities of goods or large numbers of people from one place to another, especially over a large distance:
examples: vận chuyển
▪ The plane is used for transporting military personnel.
transport somebody/something to/from/across etc: vận chuyển/dẫn ai/cái gì tới/từ/theo
▪ The company transports meat across the country in refrigerated containers.
▪ Raw materials were transported to Phoenix from the reservations.
▪ The incident raised concerns about the safety and security of nuclear weapons being transported through Europe.
transportverb[ T ]GOODS/PEOPLE chuyên chở, vận tải
to take goods or people from one place to another
_The pipeline was constructed to transport oilacrossAlaskatoports on the coast.
_Such heavy items are expensive to transport (byplane).

children.name: fly
children.definition: to take people from one place to another by plane:
examples: chở ai đi ( bằng máy bay )
fly somebody to/from/back etc:
chở ai đi máy bay tới/từ/trở về
▪ His company flew him to Rio to attend the conference.
▪ I’m not allowed to fly visitors into the National Park area without permission.
▪ Medical equipment and food are being flown into the areas worst hit by the disaster.
fly/flaɪ/ [transitive verb] to take goods from one place to another by plane:
vận chuyển, chở cái gì bằng máy bay
fly something to/from/back etc: ai đi máy bay tới/từ/trở về
▪ Medical equipment and food are being flown into the areas worst hit by the disaster.

children.name: ship
children.definition: to take goods a long distance to another place in aship, plane, truck or train, so that they can be used or sold:
examples: vận chuyển ( hàng hóa )
ship something to/from/back etc: vận chuyển tới/từ/về
▪ About half of the whisky produced in Scotland is shipped to Japan and the US.
▪ I’m a manufacturer, and I ship electronic goods across the Mexican border, so the new levies will definitely affect my business.
shipment[countable/uncountable noun]sự vận chuyển
goods that are being shipped, or the process of shipping them:
▪ a reduction in oil shipments
▪ Hundreds of cars are lined up outside the factory, awaiting shipment to France and Holland.

children.name: carry
children.definition: to take people or things from one place to another in a vehicle, ship, or plane: vận chuyển, chuyên chở
examples: The ship was carrying drugs.
There are more airplanes carrying more people than ever before.
Air India carried 1.66 million passengers last year.
The Jeep was carrying six men from the artillery brigade. Only one survived.
carry sb/sth to/from/across etc:

children.name: The train was carrying passengers from Moscow to St Petersburg
examples: The ship was carrying a cargo of oil from Kuwait to Japan.

children.name: the process of taking goods or people from one place to another
haulage
children.definition: British /haulingAmerican   the business of taking large quantities of goods from one place to another:
examples: vận chuyển, chuyên chở
▪ Rail freight charges are high compared with the cost of road haulage
.▪ The company also provides commercial hauling for the city of San Diego.
haulage company/costs/contractor etc: công ty vận chuyển/phí vận chuyển/hợp đồng vận chuyển
▪ Jean works for a road haulage company based in St Etienne.
haulagenoun[ U ]UK
ngành chuyên chở hàng(bằngđường bộ / sắt )
the business of moving things by road or railway
_a road haulage firm

children.name: transport
examples: vận chuyển
▪ We need more investment in natural gas distribution and transportation.
transport to: vận chuyển tới
▪ The price is $40, which includes transportation to the game and refreshments.
transport of: vận chuyển cái gì
▪ The government is planning to tighten up regulations governing the transport of toxic waste.
transport costs/systems/companies etc: phí vận chuyển/hệ thống vận chuyển/công ty vận chuyển
▪ Carrying goods by ship reduces transportation costs.
▪ Critics have pointed to the lack of transport links to the new attraction.
transportnounGOODS/PEOPLEchuyên chở, vận tải
[ U ] when people or goods are moved from one place to another
_the transport of live animals
_The company will arrange transport from the airport.

children.name: transit
examples: in transit/ɪn ˈtrænst, -zt/ [adverb] while being taken from one place to another:
trong quá trình vận chuyển
▪ A good insurance policy will cover the cost of goods lost or damaged in transit.
▪ Cheese continues to ripen while in transit, so storage is important.

children.name: the movement of goods or people from one place to another
examples: _It is possible to make an insurance claim for any goods lost or damagedintransit.
_The question is whether road transit is cheaper than rail.

children.name: a system of vehicles for getting from one place to another
transport
examples: a system of vehicles,such as buses, trains, aircraft, etc. for getting from one place to another
_the Department of Transport ( bo phan van tai )
_investment inpublictransport (= buses, trains, etc. available for everyone to use)
_Do you have your own transport (= vehicle) ?
_Bicycles are a cheap and efficientform oftransport.

children.name: cargo
examples: the goods carried by a ship, aircraft or other large vehicle
_a cargo ship/plane
_The ship was carrying a cargoofwool fromEnglandtoFrance.
